Returns: Where the optional prompt view should appear.

postShow().Description: Post a @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#show_E@ call to the UI thread.

Returns: true if the event was handled, false if it was ignored.
Parameters: int: keyCode param passed to the host view's onKeyPreIme
KeyEvent: event param passed to the host view's onKeyPreIme
onKeyPreIme(int, android.view.KeyEvent).Description: Filter pre-IME key events. By forwarding @B_android#view#View#onKeyPreIme_E@ events to this function, views using ListPopupWindow can have it dismiss the popup when the back key is pressed.

Parameters: boolean: true if the popup window should be modal, false otherwise.
setModal(boolean).Description: Set whether this window should be modal when shown. If a popup window is modal, it will receive all touch and key input. If the user touches outside the popup window's content area the popup window will be dismissed.

Parameters: View: The view to use as an anchor.
setAnchorView(android.view.View).Description: Sets the popup's anchor view. This popup will always be positioned relative to the anchor view when shown.

getAnchorView().Description: Returns the view that will be used to anchor this popup.

Returns: The position of the currently selected item or @B_android#widget#AdapterView#INVALID_POSITION_E@ if @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#isShowing_E@ == false.
Animation style that will be used.
getAnimationStyle().Description: Returns the animation style that will be used when the popup window is shown or dismissed.

clearListSelection().Description: Clear any current list selection. Only valid when @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#isShowing_E@ == true.

Returns: true if this popup is configured to assume the user does not need to interact with the IME while it is showing, false otherwise.

Parameters: Context: Context used for contained views.
ListPopupWindow(android.content.Context).Description: Create a new, empty popup window capable of displaying items from a ListAdapter. Backgrounds should be set using @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#setBackgroundDrawable_E@.

Returns: The background drawable for the popup window.

Parameters: int: Desired width of content in pixels.
setContentWidth(int).Description: Sets the width of the popup window by the size of its content. The final width may be larger to accommodate styled window dressing.

Parameters: int: The vertical offset of the popup from its anchor.
setVerticalOffset(int).Description: Set the vertical offset of this popup from its anchor view in pixels.

Returns: a touch listener that controls drag-to-open behavior
Parameters: View: the view on which the resulting listener will be set
createDragToOpenListener(android.view.Vi.Description: Returns an @B_android#view#View#OnTouchListener_E@ that can be added to the source view to implement drag-to-open behavior. Generally, the source view should be the same view that was passed to @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#setAnchorView_E@. When the listener is set on a view, touching that view and dragging outside of its bounds will open the popup window. Lifting will select the currently touched list item. Example usage:

Parameters: int: Width of the popup window.
setWidth(int).Description: Sets the width of the popup window in pixels. Can also be @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#MATCH_PARENT_E@ or @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#WRAP_CONTENT_E@.

setDropDownGravity(int).Description: Set the gravity of the dropdown list. This is commonly used to set gravity to START or END for alignment with the anchor.

Returns: The width of the popup window in pixels.

Parameters: View: View to use as an informational prompt.
setPromptView(android.view.View).Description: Set a view to act as a user prompt for this popup window. Where the prompt view will appear is controlled by @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#setPromptPosition_E@.

Returns: The View for the currently selected item or null if @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#isShowing_E@ == false.

Parameters: ListAdapter: The adapter to use to create this window's content.
setAdapter(android.widget.ListAdapter).Description: Sets the adapter that provides the data and the views to represent the data in this popup window.

show().Description: Show the popup list. If the list is already showing, this method will recalculate the popup's size and position.

Parameters: int: Layout type for this window.
setWindowLayoutType(int).Description: Set the layout type for this popup window. See @B_android#view#WindowManager#LayoutParams#type_E@ for possible values.

Parameters: int: Height of the popup window must be a positive value, @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#MATCH_PARENT_E@, or @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#WRAP_CONTENT_E@.
Throws: if height is set to negative value
setHeight(int).Description: Sets the height of the popup window in pixels. Can also be @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#MATCH_PARENT_E@.

Returns: The @B_android#widget#ListView_E@ displayed within the popup window. Only valid when @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#isShowing_E@ == true.

setInputMethodMode(int).Description: Control how the popup operates with an input method: one of @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#INPUT_METHOD_FROM_FOCUSABLE_E@, @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#INPUT_METHOD_NEEDED_E@, or @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#INPUT_METHOD_NOT_NEEDED_E@. If the popup is showing, calling this method will take effect only the next time the popup is shown or through a manual call to the @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#show_E@ method.

Returns: The ID of the currently selected item or @B_android#widget#AdapterView#INVALID_ROW_ID_E@ if @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#isShowing_E@ == false.
true if the popup is currently showing, false otherwise.
true if the click action could be performed, false if not. (e.g. if the popup was not showing, this method would return false.)
Parameters: int: Adapter position for performing the click
performItemClick(int).Description: Perform an item click operation on the specified list adapter position.

Returns: The height of the popup window in pixels.

Parameters: int: The horizontal offset of the popup from its anchor.
setHorizontalOffset(int).Description: Set the horizontal offset of this popup from its anchor view in pixels.

Returns: The currently selected item or null if the popup is not showing.

Parameters: int: A position constant declaring where the prompt should be displayed.
setPromptPosition(int).Description: Set where the optional prompt view should appear. The default is @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#POSITION_PROMPT_ABOVE_E@.

Returns: true if the event was handled, false if it was ignored.
Parameters: int: keyCode param passed to the host view's onKeyUp
KeyEvent: event param passed to the host view's onKeyUp
onKeyUp(int, android.view.KeyEvent).Description: Filter key up events. By forwarding key up events to this function, views using non-modal ListPopupWindow can have it handle key selection of items.

Returns: true if the event was handled, false if it was ignored.
Parameters: int: keyCode param passed to the host view's onKeyDown
KeyEvent: event param passed to the host view's onKeyDown
onKeyDown(int, android.view.KeyEvent).Description: Filter key down events. By forwarding key down events to this function, views using non-modal ListPopupWindow can have it handle key selection of items.

Returns: true if the popup window will be modal, false otherwise.
isModal().Description: Returns whether the popup window will be modal when shown.

Returns: The horizontal offset of the popup from its anchor in pixels.

Parameters: int: List position to set as selected.
setSelection(int).Description: Set the selected position of the list. Only valid when @B_android#support#v7#widget#ListPopupWindow#isShowing_E@ == true.

Returns: The vertical offset of the popup from its anchor in pixels.

Parameters: int: The desired mode, see @B_android#view#WindowManager#LayoutParams#softInputMode_E@ for the full list
setSoftInputMode(int).Description: Sets the operating mode for the soft input area.

setAnimationStyle(int).Description: Set an animation style to use when the popup window is shown or dismissed.

ClassDesc: Static library support version of the framework's https:##developer#android#com@B_android#widget#ListPopupWindow_E@. Used to write apps that run on platforms prior to Android L. When running on Android L or above, this implementation is still used; it does not try to switch to the framework's implementation. See the framework SDK documentation for a class overview.
